title: EU court of justice allows cops to look into phones for small crimes
description: About cops & phone access. This decision has been made over 85 grams of weed.
content:
It should be noted that I am not a legal expert. The following seems to be the case:
- Police are now allowed to enter your phone for less severe crimes 
- Individual EU members have to implement this in their own legal codex. E.g.: this is just a statement that it is *not* against EU rules to do so

## Forced opening
- In **Belgium**, [cops are allowed to force you to give your code. Good luck! (Dutch/Belgian news site (Tweakers))](https://tweakers.net/nieuws/163116/belgische-rechter-verdachte-mag-verplicht-worden-code-smartphone-af-te-staan.html)
- In the **Netherlands**, [cops are allowed to forcibly use open your phone using biometrics (Dutch/Belgian news site (Tweakers))](https://tweakers.net/nieuws/177886/hoge-raad-politie-mag-telefoon-onder-dwang-ontgrendelen-met-vingerafdruk.html)

## What now?
### Safe biometric locking
So, as long as the Netherlands doesn't implement rulings similar Belgium's; how can you protect yourself?

- **iOS:** Hold the power/side button and either volume button for 2 seconds. Next time you try to unlock your phone, it will ask for your PIN code before allowing biometric unlock. This works when the phone is locked and unlocked
- **Google Pixel:** Hold the power & volume up button until a menu appears. Select Lockdown from there. See [9to5google's Google Pixel lockdown article](https://9to5google.com/2022/03/08/how-to-enable-lockdown-mode-on-pixel/)
- Many phones have their own implementation. Look up "disabling biometric unlock", "lockdown mode" or "hard lock" with your phone manufacturer & model.
